instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2179: What is A2179? A2179 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2020 with EMC 3302, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01958..
definitions.820-01958: What is 820-01958? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Air 2020 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> stalls during startup
threads.message:
This board is showing 20V USB-C, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.6V, <SIGNAL>PPVCC_NAND_SSD0</SIGNAL> 2.5V. It displays the Apple logo but then goes into super-sluggish mode, with the cursor responding in a delayed and extremely slow fashion. Fan is blowing high. It stalls during startup and I can't even launch Internet Recovery.

No obvious liquid damage. I successfully performed a DFU Restore but it still stalls indefinitely during startup. I have also tried a known-good battery and an SMC reset. Any ideas as for what else to check on this board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Air 2020 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> stalls during startup
threads.message:
Fan spins high if there is a thermal issue.
Check first with external monitor, disconnecting internal LCD (J8500).
May need to test with known good trackpad flex/board also.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Air 2020 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> stalls during startup
threads.message: Found a CPU fault; no need to work on this any further.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Air 2020 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2179</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> stalls during startup
threads.message: what fault did you find exactly?
